channel.title: Posts on Practical Disregard
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Practical Disregard

item.title: #TidyTuesday Week 50 Plot Replicas
item.description: Documenation Plots are replicated based on Battling Infectious Diseases in the 20th Century: The Impact of Vaccines by Tynan DeBold and Dov Friedman.

item.title: Population Change
item.description: Introduction This is the first of what I hope to be a series of demographic explorations inspired by a recent presentation from Dr.

item.title: Weather Data
item.description: The Boring Bits # Load packages ---- library(tidyverse) library(tigris) library(sf) library(riem) library(kableExtra) Finding Home Let’s start by grabbing the Chapel Hill boundary and then doing a test plot.

item.title: Summer Meals: Census Tract Optimization
item.description: Required Packages library(tidyverse) library(sf) library(tidycensus) library(sp) library(tigris) Macro Geographies Durham County Polygon nc_counties <- counties(state = "37") durham_county_sf <- nc_counties %>% st_as_sf() %>% filter(NAME == "Durham") Durham County Census Tracts durham_tracts <- tracts(state = "37", county = "063") durham_tracts_sf <- durham_tracts %>% st_as_sf() Creating Decision Factors To isolate the census tracts of potential focus, we will first use five different data points from ACS 5-years estimates for Durham County.

item.title: #ELGL19 On Twitter: A Brief Synthesis
item.description: The Boring Bits library(tidyverse) library(lubridate) library(tidytext) library(kableExtra) tweets <- read_rds("data/tweets.rds") %>% as_tibble() f <- function(time) { x <- time hour(x) <- hour(x)-4 return(x) }

item.title: I Like It When You Call Me Large SpatialPolygonsDataFrame
item.description: Welcome to the wonderful world of R-Spatial! I really enjoy playing around with spatial data in R and for some reason find it much easier than ArcGIS (#sorrynotsorry Esri).

item.title: Spatial Exploration - MUSA Masterclass
item.description: This post was inspired by the MUSA Masterclass provided very graciously by Ken Steif and James Cheshire. If you aren’t familiar with the program I would strongly encourage you to check it out - UPenn MUSA Program.

item.title: City of Raleigh Budget Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Package Import Load necessary packages and set one global option. library(tidyverse) library(pdftools) library(tidytext) library(knitr) library(kableExtra) Retrieve File Download the file from the City of Raleigh website, read that file in as a character vector, and delete the downloaded file from the directory.
